meta
variables.rawdescription:
Button component for user interactions and actions.

## Usage Guide

**When to use:**
- Primary actions (submit forms, confirm dialogs)
- Navigation triggers
- Start processes or workflows

**When NOT to use:**
- Navigation between pages (use links instead)
- Toggling settings (use toggle/switch)
- Displaying status (use badge/tag)

## Accessibility
- âœ… Keyboard navigation (Enter/Space)
- âœ… Focus visible states
- âœ… Disabled state prevents interaction
- âœ… Loading state with spinner
- ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid "Click here")
- ðŸ’¡ Consider aria-label for icon-only buttons
variables.description:
Button component for user interactions and actions.

Usage Guide

When to use:

  • Primary actions (submit forms, confirm dialogs)
  • Navigation triggers
  • Start processes or workflows

When NOT to use:

  • Navigation between pages (use links instead)
  • Toggling settings (use toggle/switch)
  • Displaying status (use badge/tag)

Accessibility

  • âœ… Keyboard navigation (Enter/Space)
  • âœ… Focus visible states
  • âœ… Disabled state prevents interaction
  • âœ… Loading state with spinner
  • ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid "Click here")
  • ðŸ’¡ Consider aria-label for icon-only buttons

variables.name: meta
variables.rawdescription:
Badge component for labels, status indicators, and notifications.

## Usage Guide

**When to use:**
- Display status or category labels
- Show notification counts
- Indicate new/updated content
- Tag items with metadata
- Show removable filter tags

**When NOT to use:**
- As a clickable action (use button instead)
- For long descriptive text (use label or text)
- As form validation (use input error state)

## Accessibility
- âœ… role="status" for screen readers
- âœ… Close button with aria-label
- âœ… Keyboard navigation for removable badges
- âœ… Focus visible states on close button
- âœ… Sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA)
- ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid single letters)
- ðŸ’¡ Provide context for screen readers when needed
variables.description:
Badge component for labels, status indicators, and notifications.

Usage Guide

When to use:

  • Display status or category labels
  • Show notification counts
  • Indicate new/updated content
  • Tag items with metadata
  • Show removable filter tags

When NOT to use:

  • As a clickable action (use button instead)
  • For long descriptive text (use label or text)
  • As form validation (use input error state)

Accessibility

  • âœ… role="status" for screen readers
  • âœ… Close button with aria-label
  • âœ… Keyboard navigation for removable badges
  • âœ… Focus visible states on close button
  • âœ… Sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA)
  • ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid single letters)
  • ðŸ’¡ Provide context for screen readers when needed

variables.name: meta
variables.rawdescription:
Input component for user text entry.

## Usage Guide

**When to use:**
- Text, email, password, search, number, etc.
- Search bars, forms, filters

**When NOT to use:**
- Multi-line input (use textarea)
- Selection (use select, radio, checkbox)

## Accessibility
- âœ… Label is always associated with input
- âœ… Keyboard navigation
- âœ… Error and helper text with aria-describedby
- âœ… Disabled and readonly states
- ðŸ’¡ Use aria-label for icon-only or hidden label
variables.description:
Input component for user text entry.

Usage Guide

When to use:

  • Text, email, password, search, number, etc.
  • Search bars, forms, filters

When NOT to use:

  • Multi-line input (use textarea)
  • Selection (use select, radio, checkbox)

Accessibility

  • âœ… Label is always associated with input
  • âœ… Keyboard navigation
  • âœ… Error and helper text with aria-describedby
  • âœ… Disabled and readonly states
  • ðŸ’¡ Use aria-label for icon-only or hidden label

variables.name: MultipleIcons
variables.defaultValue:
{
  render: (args) => ({
    props: {
      ...args,
      value: '',
    },
    template: `
      <zg-input
        [label]="label"
        [placeholder]="placeholder"
        [value]="value"
        [type]="type"
        [size]="size"
        [disabled]="disabled"
        [readonly]="readonly"
        [fullWidth]="fullWidth"
        [autocomplete]="autocomplete"
        [maxlength]="maxlength"
        [helperText]="helperText"
        (changed)="changed($event)"
        (focused)="focused($event)"
        (blurred)="blurred($event)"
        (cleared)="cleared()"
      >
        <svg icon-left width="20" height="20" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><circle cx="11" cy="11" r="8"/><line x1="21" y1="21" x2="16.65" y2="16.65"/></svg>
        <svg icon-right width="20" height="20" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><circle cx="11" cy="11" r="8"/><line x1="21" y1="21" x2="16.65" y2="16.65"/></svg>
      </zg-input>
    `,
  }),
}

variables.defaultValue:
{
  args: {
    label: 'Clearable',
    placeholder: 'Type to show clear',
    value: 'Clear me',
  },
  render: (args) => ({
    props: args,
    template: `
      <zg-input
        [label]="label"
        [placeholder]="placeholder"
        [value]="value"
        [type]="type"
        [size]="size"
        [disabled]="disabled"
        [readonly]="readonly"
        [error]="error"
        [fullWidth]="fullWidth"
        [autocomplete]="autocomplete"
        [maxlength]="maxlength"
        [helperText]="helperText"
        (changed)="changed($event)"
        (focused)="focused($event)"
        (blurred)="blurred($event)"
        (cleared)="cleared()"
      >
        <svg clear-icon width="16" height="16" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><line x1="18" y1="6" x2="6" y2="18"/><line x1="6" y1="6" x2="18" y2="18"/></svg>
      </zg-input>
    `,
  }),
}

projects/ui/src/lib/atoms/badge/badge.st.rawdescription:
Badge component for labels, status indicators, and notifications.

## Usage Guide

**When to use:**
- Display status or category labels
- Show notification counts
- Indicate new/updated content
- Tag items with metadata
- Show removable filter tags

**When NOT to use:**
- As a clickable action (use button instead)
- For long descriptive text (use label or text)
- As form validation (use input error state)

## Accessibility
- âœ… role="status" for screen readers
- âœ… Close button with aria-label
- âœ… Keyboard navigation for removable badges
- âœ… Focus visible states on close button
- âœ… Sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA)
- ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid single letters)
- ðŸ’¡ Provide context for screen readers when needed

Input component for user text entry.

## Usage Guide

**When to use:**
- Text, email, password, search, number, etc.
- Search bars, forms, filters

**When NOT to use:**
- Multi-line input (use textarea)
- Selection (use select, radio, checkbox)

## Accessibility
- âœ… Label is always associated with input
- âœ… Keyboard navigation
- âœ… Error and helper text with aria-describedby
- âœ… Disabled and readonly states
- ðŸ’¡ Use aria-label for icon-only or hidden label

projects/ui/src/lib/atoms/button/button..rawdescription:
Button component for user interactions and actions.

## Usage Guide

**When to use:**
- Primary actions (submit forms, confirm dialogs)
- Navigation triggers
- Start processes or workflows

**When NOT to use:**
- Navigation between pages (use links instead)
- Toggling settings (use toggle/switch)
- Displaying status (use badge/tag)

## Accessibility
- âœ… Keyboard navigation (Enter/Space)
- âœ… Focus visible states
- âœ… Disabled state prevents interaction
- âœ… Loading state with spinner
- ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid "Click here")
- ðŸ’¡ Consider aria-label for icon-only buttons

  • Start processes or workflows

When NOT to use:

  • Navigation between pages (use links instead)
  • Toggling settings (use toggle/switch)
  • Displaying status (use badge/tag)

Accessibility

  • âœ… Keyboard navigation (Enter/Space)
  • âœ… Focus visible states
  • âœ… Disabled state prevents interaction
  • âœ… Loading state with spinner
  • ðŸ’¡ Use descriptive text (avoid "Click here")
  • ðŸ’¡ Consider aria-label for icon-only buttons
